Getting Started with Scrap Mechanic Modding

This guide will walk you through the basics of setting up your development environment and creating your first mod for Scrap Mechanic.

Prerequisites

Before you begin, make sure you have:

A copy of Scrap Mechanic installed on your computer

Basic understanding of file structures and editing JSON files

A text editor (we recommend Visual Studio Code)

Image editing software for textures (optional)

Basic understanding of Lua programming (for advanced mods)

Setting Up Your Development Environment

Step 1: Find Your Scrap Mechanic Installation

First, you need to locate your Scrap Mechanic installation folder. By default, it's usually in:

Windows: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Scrap Mechanic

macOS: ~/Library/Application Support/Steam/steamapps/common/Scrap Mechanic

Linux: ~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Scrap Mechanic

Testing Your Mod

To test your mod:

Start Scrap Mechanic

Load a creative or survival game

Your mod should be automatically loaded if in the correct directory

Next Steps

Once you've created your first basic mod, you might want to explore:

Item Creation - Learn how to create custom items

Lua Scripting - Add custom behaviors with Lua scripts

JSON Formatting - Master the JSON format used by Scrap Mechanic

Troubleshooting

If your mod isn't showing up:

Double-check file paths and locations

Verify JSON syntax (use a JSON validator)

Check the game's log files for errors

Make sure your mod supports the current game version

Scrap Mechanic Modding Documentation

Welcome to the official ReDoIng Mods documentation. This guide will help you get started with modding Scrap Mechanic and creating amazing content for the game.

What is Scrap Mechanic?

Scrap Mechanic is a creative multiplayer sandbox game that allows players to build vehicles, structures, and contraptions using a variety of parts and blocks. The game features a robust physics system and offers plenty of opportunities for creative expression through modding.

Why Mod Scrap Mechanic?

Modding Scrap Mechanic allows you to:

Add new items, blocks, and parts to the game

Create custom gameplay mechanics

Enhance the existing game features

Share your creations with the community

Collaborate with other modders

Getting Started

If you're new to modding Scrap Mechanic, we recommend starting with our Getting Started guide, which covers the basic tools and concepts you'll need to know.

Community Resources

The Scrap Mechanic modding community is active and helpful. Here are some resources you might find useful:

Scrap Mechanic Workshop

Scrap Mechanic Modding Wiki

3rd party modding wiki

Contributing to This Documentation

We welcome contributions to this documentation! If you find errors, have suggestions for improvements, or want to add new content, please visit our GitHub repository and submit a pull request.
